borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposal, by reason of scale, mass and siting, would be an undesirable addition which would result in an unacceptable loss of daylight and overshadowing to the neighbouring dwelling. As such, the proposal constitutes unneighbourly development, causing harm to the amenity of neighbouring occupiers. The proposal thus fails to accord with the following policies&nbsp;which seek to ensure development proposals protect residential amenity:</p><p>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</p><p>Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p>Sections 4.2, 5.3 and&nbsp;5.4 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p>Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>

<p>The proposal, by reason of scale, bulk, mass, siting and design, would be an undesirable addition which would not appear subservient to the original dwelling, would unbalance the symmetry of the terrace row, has a discordant roofscape, would close off the corner plot and would result in an incoherent&nbsp;composition when viewed from the streetscape along Craven Gardens. As such, the proposal fails to respect and reflect the character and appearance of the original dwelling, terrace row and wider area, causing harm to each of these. The proposal thus fails to&nbsp;accord with the following policies which seek to ensure development proposals are well designed, respect and reflect the existing character:</p><p>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</p><p>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</p><p>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p>Sections 4.1,&nbsp;5.3 and 5.4&nbsp;of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p>Policies SP2 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>
description: Construction of a part double storey side and rear extension.
